body_html:
Is there anything special to do after the compilation to include the new Op?
I'm using the Ackermann_ops example, compiled the headers and then the Op and then tried to run the ackermann_test.py script.
It returns the following error though

`
ERROR: testBasic (main.AckermannTest)

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "C:/tf_compile/tensorflow/tensorflow/user_ops/ackermann_test.py", line 30, in testBasic
ackermann = tf.load_op_library(library_filename)
File "C:\Users\Me\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python35\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\framework\load_library.py", line 64, in load_op_library
None, None, error_msg, error_code)
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: C:\tf_compile\tensorflow\tensorflow\user_ops\ackermann_ops.so not found
`

Needless to say that the file is in the directory.
The actual Tf version I'm using was installed directly from the pip package

body:
Is there anything special to do after the compilation to include the new Op?
I'm using the Ackermann_ops example, compiled the headers and then the Op and then tried to run the ackermann_test.py script.
It returns the following error though

`
ERROR: testBasic (__main__.AckermannTest)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/tf_compile/tensorflow/tensorflow/user_ops/ackermann_test.py", line 30, in testBasic
    ackermann = tf.load_op_library(library_filename)
  File "C:\Users\Me\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python35\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\framework\load_library.py", line 64, in load_op_library
    None, None, error_msg, error_code)
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: C:\tf_compile\tensorflow\tensorflow\user_ops\ackermann_ops.so not found
`

Needless to say that the file is in the directory.
The actual Tf version I'm using was installed directly from the pip package
